column1: A lump in the abdomen is a small area of swelling or bulge of tissue in the belly.
Most often, a lump in the abdomen is caused by a hernia.
An abdominal hernia occurs when there is a weak spot in the abdominal wall.
There are several types of hernias, based on where they occur: - Inguinal hernia appears as a bulge in the groin or scrotum.

Other causes of a lump in the abdominal wall include: - Hematoma (collection of blood under the skin after injury) - Lipoma (collection of fatty tissue under the skin) - Lymph nodes - Tumor of the skin or muscles
Call your health care provider if you have a lump in your abdomen especially if it becomes larger, changes color, or is painful.
- Your hernia is causing more pain.
The provider will examine you and ask questions about your medical history and symptoms, such as: - Where is the lump located?
- When did you first notice the lump in your abdomen?
